website_summaries.verdict: Bargain price for a cat flea comb. Should work on all types of coats you'll find with cats.
pros: Tight spacing of teeth in the comb are able to easily grab fleas and insect eggs
Handle on the comb has a shape that makes it comfortable to hold and use
Works to part the fur to find skin blemishes, too
cons: Teeth aren't long enough to work on dog fur
Handle may snap if put under stress

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Don't recommend keeping it in hot water since it will eventually melt but you can dip it and swirl it in boiling water to kill off fleas quickly Toby says hello. Not gonna lie a little hard since he's a short hair domestic. But it still worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It dose exactly what it is made to do. I’d definitely follow suggestions of water with a little bit of dish soap in it in order to drown the fleas that are caught in the brush. This isn’t my cats favorite brush but it’s a satisfying purchase for his human.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Easy, and happy cats
customer_reviews.text: Excellent flea comb for my four cats. I do not have much of a flea problem...4 indoor cats...but occasionally the dog brings in a few so I give the cats regular combing to get rid of the occasional flea. This one handles well, is easier to use than the ones without handles, and does not seem to bother the cats..they mostly enjoy the combing. Also, the teeth are not prone to bending as some other combs I have used are, even when used on my thickest coated cat (they are all short hairs but two have incredibly bushy coats). Not incidentally, a great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cowdog

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: I just got this 10min ago and my reaction was WOOW. I gave my cat anti flea medication in the morning and with this brush i can remove all the dead fleas. It really works and my cat loves it too. Brush has metal parts that are spaced out very closely but enough to pass through cats fur. Easy to hold and work with. It also removes excess hair from my younger cat that looses a lot of hair every day. Both cats also like it as a grooming brush.
customer_reviews.author: Maciej

customer_reviews.title: My first one- I wish I'd had one years ago !!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to do a pretty good job and is easy to use. It catches tiny and big fleas both. I have a medium silky-fur cat and a fluffy one with thick fur. The thick fur is more challenging, but it does ok on the head, back, and upper sides. It works really well on my other cat! Flea treatments were not working, and I bought good brands. This was a last resort. I never thought they'd work very well.... but they do!
customer_reviews.author: Koalaness

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these on my cats for years. I like the grip handle, and I have recently found that they a easy to use on certain types of furniture to clean up the hair my cat leaves behind. My Tabby use to really love being combed with this comb, and he would sit for a long time enjoying it. They are good for checking to see if your cat has flea issues since the flea will get trapped in the comb.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Fleas will get away.  Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: I have regularly used a flea comb on my dog and cat for years. I wanted to get spares for traveling and our weekend cabin. I used this comb ONE TIME on my dog and 2 of the teeth broke off, leaving 2 gaps in the brand new flea comb. Not useful in the battle against fleas! If by chance you do need a better comb for your robotic vacuum - this could do the trick! Broken teeth here don't really matter, and this works so much better than the small plastic combs the companies provide with your bot! It's still a 1 star for the fleas, though....
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen F.

customer_reviews.title: Helps remove dandruff.
customer_reviews.text: My overweight kitty cat doesn't always groom his lower back as well as he should. I noticed severe dandruff about 2 weeks ago. I took the appropriate measures, daily brushing, better diet for his coat etc. I found this really helped get those large flakes off. It also works great just to part the fur if you're trying to check your kittys skin or apply topical medicine. His skin is looking much better. The handle makes it very comfortable to use. I usually use a baby wipe or a damp napkin to remove the hair. I disinfect it at least once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT! Sturdy handle super for my long haired cat and she loves being brushed!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first and hoped I would not need this after applying Flea Treatment but thank goodness I purchased. The "less expensive" flea treatment I purchased did not work as promised and I have used this brush/flea comb on my 2 cats since mid December and I use a Chemical Free Flea Spray with it (which is outstanding). I'm going to purchase a couple more...to have around house.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how my INDOOR cat got fleas, but this comb was perfect in removing the little buggers! My cat LOVES getting combed with this! She no longer has fleas, but as soon as I say, “Let’s get brushed”, she’s happily ready! This comb is not harsh at all. As soon as the comb grabs fleas, dunk it in a bucket of water with some safe soap product to drown the fleas. Plain water doesn’t work as well. Soap causes a flea to drown. Apparently fleas can survive for awhile in plain water. Just make sure it’s a mild soap because you’re using this on a cat...and cats lick their fur. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Eleonore

customer_reviews.title: not well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old flea comb. it is cheaply made for the price. Feels like the metal teeth part will come off when you are combing. I will be looking for another similar to what I had.
customer_reviews.author: Green family

customer_reviews.title: My foster babies came with a little extra
customer_reviews.text: Cute foster babies came with not so cute fleas!!! This comb really caught those suckers! We found applying a ring of kitten shampoo (or baby shampoo) around their necks. Then bathing them and since they were young we were able to soak them up to their necks in warm water. Just combed the fleas off that were still stuck. Use white towels so you can see them come off. We repeated this. I use the flea comb to check for fleas and flea dirt every couple of days.....so far so good! This is the best comb I have used!!
customer_reviews.author: Disney Fan

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend for long hair cats
customer_reviews.text: It's alright for the price, I guess. It's fairly cheaply made, so I don't know how durable it is. I also don't know how effective it is because I barely tried. It's almost impossible to use on a long hair cat. The teeth get tangled in the hair and pull at it and my cat wouldn't tolerate it. I also wish the ends of the teeth were rounded rather than square and sharp because they don't glide across the skin and can be rough if you're not careful. It also is not comfortable or easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: mcf

customer_reviews.title: Good Size for Mini Dachshund
customer_reviews.text: I use this comb for my mini dachshund head, face and paws. The comb length is shorter than my other flea comb so its easier to comb small areas. I use the older flea comb for the body. I recommend using this comb on small dogs even though it's meant for cats.
customer_reviews.author: QB

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: We have four cats and a dog. One of the cats became infested by fleas and their “dirt”. This come was amazing!! Not only did it get out over a dozen fleas, all the flea dirt came up as well. I used it four times on him the first day and pulled out fleas #1-3. Fourth time was flealess, just a couple specks of dirt. Used it this morning and it came away clean. I wish that I had known about this comb a long time ago. Another plus....all four cats and the dog love to be combed with this. And my dog hates to be combed or brushed with anything.
customer_reviews.author: Anna from CA

customer_reviews.title: Works well when used properly.
customer_reviews.text: Comb the fur on kittens to get flea pests without using poison. A glass of water with a few drops of cedar oil and/or eugenol and Dawn to dip in and rinse fleas off the comb is handy to have next to you. Kills the fleas immediately. Someone dumped a tiny kitten on my road, he was crawling with fleas and too young to treat. Diligence and patience got me a glass with dozens and a kitten much more likely to thrive. It is funny how the price fluctuates with whether this identical product is labelled for cats or dogs. This week the cat comb is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Yelvington

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy- Doesn’t work- gets tangled - small- useless!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money! My Heartz comb (see pic) that I’ve had for 8 years is way more durable and strong and works better to pull fleas and debris out of animal. This Safari comb is very hard to use, very much smaller than in pic, bristles get fur tangled up! I am very disappointed with this purchase. It’s from Taiwan so you pay for what you get. It’s something you see in a dollar store! It’s going back! Bad purchase all the way around...
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: great product for rabbits
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a young holland lop, I noticed he had some fleas, based on other reviewers I ordered this item. It works! You need to be prepared with a cup of soapy water, like dawn, make it bubbly. When you gently comb this through the fur, you will remove shedding fur, flea debris, dead fleas and live fleas Be quick the fleas can jump, brush, then gently but quickly submerse comb in soapy liquid wipe off clean. So, yes it is good for rabbits! My bunny likes to have me comb him, be gentle and thorough, you and your bunny will be happy and flea free!
customer_reviews.author: Nature Chic

customer_reviews.title: Must have.
customer_reviews.text: We are battling an unexpected flea invasion which shouldn't have happened. Two indoor kittens that we brought home from the shelter freshly treated for fleas. Anyway if you want to know if there are live fleas on your animal you must have one of these. The blade is a little small but any bigger it would probably jam up because the teeth are so close together. Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Removed 2 fleas in under 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to use the human lice comb on our dog with moderate success for the past month. She had started hating the comb and me at the same time. But this caught the two fleas that have been bothering her in less than 5 minutes. And then she allowed me to continue combing her for the next 15 minutes while she calmly lay beside me. It has been great for puppy and momma both!
customer_reviews.author: PalsLivesLife

customer_reviews.title: Tried several...this was my favorite
customer_reviews.text: Having a particularly bad flea season I decided to get three different flea combs, not knowing which would work best for my dog and three cats and their various coat textures. This one was my favorite. Tight enough to catch the fleas, the silver teeth and green handle make the fleas easily visible and the ledge where the teeth meet the handle is sufficiently wide for flea crushing.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Tarnove

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's the comb's fault or if I have sneaky fleas but often I'll be brushing through trying to catch them and they slide right through the bristles... never heard of anyone having that issue with their brushes so again I don't know if it's this brush or if I have ninja fleas but it got aggravating fast. And if I do catch one the bristles are so wide the fleas just hide on the brush and it's difficult to get them out.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Monaghan

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: A while back my cats drug flees into the house. That mess took months to resolve. Search my reviews for more info on that. This comb is tight enough that it kept getting them out, the flees got stuck in the hair on the brush. Fire put them to death. Tried water and a few other solutions, but fire solved it. The comb feels good on my cats back, he loves it and the flees hate it. The only down fall is the handle is a bit small, OK for me, but I do have issues holding on to things, but it still works well, I dealing with my wrist pain to kill those critters.
customer_reviews.author: Cea JaysTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Flea Catcher
customer_reviews.text: I don't like using chemical drops or sprays on my cats, or most flea collars for that matter. The Safari Pet Products Flea Comb for Cats really helps groom them without the need for harsher methods. We have another style flea comb and Safari is comparable in quality and is priced right. We'll be getting this one again. The fleas don't stand a chance when this comb is used. ~ Kort
customer_reviews.author: Kort

customer_reviews.title: Mommy’s Groom Time
customer_reviews.text: This comb is a great little purchase. I can’t tell that they even have what little fleas they have unless I comb. They’re definitely not itching as much. They’re sleeping through the night, which is a good thing because all three sleep with me. One of my kiddos considers it mommie and me time. He really enjoys it. My little girl could care less. My big boy.... well, cats will be cats. He reluctantly lets me comb but not without letting out a few huge sighs in the process. Clean up is simple. There isn’t anything about this product that I could disapprove of.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Works Well...
customer_reviews.text: I take my cats for walks through my neighborhood that's littered with rabbits and squirrels. Sadly, not everyone takes steps to prevent fleas in their yard like I do so the potential for hop on riders is everywhere. I use the comb regularly so I can catch the little jerks before they become a bigger problem. I have occasionally found some that have bc I used this comb so I think it's awesome. I have 2 shorthair cats and 1 long hair. The bristles aren't long enough (and obviously too close together) to go all the way through my Persian's coat, but it still does a good job. I'm very happy with this comb. It makes maintenance easier for me.
customer_reviews.author: -S

customer_reviews.title: Search and destroy fleas and eggs
customer_reviews.text: The cat enjoyed being combed and side benefit is cleaning up a lot of the shedding. Fleas and eggs are caught in the comb and destroyed in a container of soapy water. Subsequently flush it all down the toilet. This worked well in an overall strategy including frequent vacuuming with an strong upright that has a paper bag and beater bars, washing all linens, and throw pillows that can't be washed into a hot dryer, and Capstar treatment. The combing helps to stay on top of the flea population.
customer_reviews.author: B. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Use this comb for your cat's fleas - avoid the toxic stuff.
customer_reviews.text: After a good brushing, I slightly wet this flea comb and slowly go through my cat's fur. If there are any fleas hiding, you should be able to get them with this comb: Just set a small, shallow dish of diluted, mild, dish detergent on the side and lightly touch the edge of the comb. I don't trust flea products and have stop using them - if it can kill fleas it can harm your pet. This is a more natural - SAFE way of handling fleas and your cat will enjoy the grooming as well.
customer_reviews.author: Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Pulls Out Fleas Hiding Deep in Your Pet's Coat and Hard to Reach Places
customer_reviews.text: Been battling the start of flea season, and experimenting with various methods (house and pet sprays). I was able to groom my pet with this comb and had 10 fleas off of her in about 15 minutes. Highly recommend this tool in conjunction with other control methods. For cats, there is no easy method for direct removal (meaning combs, dips and baths), but this little comb really gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly1234

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great price—Works perfectly for a task that none of us really want to do! both of my cats, which are indoor cats, somehow got fleas even though they get the monthly treatment, and it was very hard on them and us. Using this comb and a dish of soapy water twice a day was the trick to really keeping the lifecycle of these demons out of our house. A+++++
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the uber expensive comb I got at the pet supply store
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 100% indoors only cats. Somehow...somehow...fleas got in the house and found our cats. It defies logic. But it happened. I have a fancy comb that cost quite a bit at the pet supply store which was NOT doing the job so I ordered this one because the teeth are curved at the bottom so the cat's skin is not scratched. My cats LOVE this comb and it works so much better than my uber expensive comb. I should've known. The most expensive of anything is never the best.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tom

customer_reviews.title: bristles were bent
customer_reviews.text: I opened it, saw that a few of the bristles were bent. Tried it anyways knowing the fleas will not catch in those areas. Of course, they went right through those spots on the comb. But there was a small area of the comb that wasn't damaged and worked. The product shouldn't come in this condition, I've never seen any comb get like this without someone forcefully bending it. Maybe I just got the short end of the stick on this one since there are many more positive comments. Or maybe those people never used one before and were happy chasing the fleas till they actually got caught by the comb.
customer_reviews.author: robert rochau

customer_reviews.title: Glides smoothly
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are accurate. This comb is great and does what it is supposed to do. I have used a plastic comb for a few years and thought I would try this comb for a change. I really think this metal teeth comb gets more fleas because it glides on the different parts of the cat much better than the plastic combs. I am so glad I got this comb!
customer_reviews.author: M K

customer_reviews.title: ... for a vacation and our indoor cats got a bad case of fleas (we still wonder how)
customer_reviews.text: We left for a vacation and our indoor cats got a bad case of fleas (we still wonder how). After using Advantage and HARTZ UltraGuard Plus Flea & Tick Home Spray, the situation seemed to be under control and we thoroughly combed the cats with this comb to remove the dead fleas and flea poop. It is recommended to have a small pot with soapy water next to you while doing this, and dip the comb in it frequently to get rid of hairs/fleas/flea poop. It worked beautifully: I combed the cats again three days letter and no more debris came out. For reference, the cats are Ragdolls, with a long and dense coat.
customer_reviews.author: Mido

customer_reviews.title: very effective
customer_reviews.text: We have four cats and a dog. Our flea issue went from "the cats are scratching and might have fleas" to a total take-over in a matter of a few days. It has been a nightmare. But this comb has been incredibly helpful and I ordered a second one just to have around for our nightly flea killing sessions. It works on our short haired dog, short haired cats, and medium hair cat. It probably wouldn't work for long haired cats or dogs with long or thick fur. It catches those little suckers in between the teeth of comb so they can't jump away before you drown them. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: ElizabethTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Grabs fleas effectively!
customer_reviews.text: Love this flea comb. Im currently taking care of a stray cat and its hard to rid of all the fleas out his fur washing him. So while he lays with me i have a bowl of hot water with dawn dish soap and a flea killer spray in the water. Ill spray the comb and brush through his fur and quickly pull the fleas from the comb and drop them in the water - they sink right down and die! I stopped counting at 20 but i was able to clean him much much quicker as he enjoyed the brushing.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer chin

customer_reviews.title: 2 paws up! 0 fleas=happy kitties!
customer_reviews.text: This comb is awesome! Catches fleas so well! My kitties are so thankful. They don’t have enough to need meds, but they occasionally get a couple from their doggy brother that brings them inside and this helps me get rid of them so easily! It also helps comb out the loose under coat that they shed! Have a cup of soapy water and a towel to rinse the brush in. It kills the fleas and allows you to continuously brush until you’re done. We give it 2 paws up!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis S.

customer_reviews.title: CAT NOT NECESSARY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay...I do NOT own a cat! No longer own a dog... But these darn things work GREAT cleaning my boar bristle hair brushes (that crap bed-head down pillow fluff, lint, etc.!). They work GREAT for cleaning the dust brush attachment for my vacuum that get's all that little lint, fluff, etc. that get caught at the base of bristles that I don't want coming off onto whatever I vacuum next (like keyboards, lap top, suede boots, ...LOTSA STUFF! The VERY BEST USE IS FOR THE AIR PURIFIER!! (Allergic to cats, and just about everything else....so if I can't have my own kitty...I will just make due with it's comb!)
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M.Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Best I've used
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this flea comb online when I lost my other, smaller comb for my cat. It does a great job of extracting fleas. With my other, older flea comb, I'd sometimes have to pass the comb over one spot multiple times to get a smaller flea. This hasn't been the case with the Safari Flea Comb. I'd recommend this comb if your cat has a flea problem, or even just to help groom your cat.
customer_reviews.author: B J

customer_reviews.title: My cat loved this comb from the first combing.
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how many fleas I got off my cat in the first combing. The key to the success of this comb is having a cup or dish with soapy water. I used a clear plastic cup so that I could see what I was getting. As my cat laid sleeping I began to comb her carefully. I started at her head and traveled down her neck and several fleas showed up on the comb. You must quickly put the comb into the soapy water before the fleas have a chance to jump, sometimes reaching into the water with one finger to get the ones that were stuck between the teeth. Must've pulled off 50 fleas
customer_reviews.author: Karen DA

customer_reviews.title: Easiest and most effective way to remove ticks from your pets!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats, one has longer fur and the other has very dark fur. It’s hard to spot fleas on either one, but with the flea comb I find them right away. Both of my cats love the way the comb feels, so they’ll stretch out and let me use it. After combing them for just 10 minutes, I was able to rid all of the fleas. Then using flea powder and vacuuming the carpet, I have not seen any fleas for almost a month. The flea comb is great to check your pet regularly, so continue to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Cats new past time now
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 combs. I have 2 short haired cats and one long hair. I have no flea problem at all. I just bought them to groom the 2 short haired cats and remove the hair they shed. These cats love love love this comb. Who knew ? It removes a great amount of hair and they get attention at the same time. I am thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Maz

customer_reviews.title: Best $4 Spent; HONESTLY
customer_reviews.text: Got a new cat who likes to explore outside & got fleas.. I thought it was going to be a mission but this works very VERY well. (Ordered it until my bayer flea collar comes in). COMB IN OPPOSITE DIRECTION OF HAIR. HAVE A ZIPLOCK ON HAND. comb out flea. Put finger on it quick to prevent it from jumping. Quickly put in bag.... Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Hibz

customer_reviews.title: seems to work
customer_reviews.text: A basic flea comb like I've seen my vet use. Although my short-haired, non-outdoor cats have never had fleas, I like to have a flea comb available to check them for insects if I take them outside for a few minutes. The small, tight-teeth comb also neatly grooms their undercoats, in small areas that can be hard to brush precisely, like around the head and neck. And kitties seem to enjoy the way the comb feels. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Siddique

customer_reviews.title: Good durable cat comb for general use
customer_reviews.text: After looking over reviews for similar products, I settled on this product and bought two to replace a similar flea comb that had lasted ~10 years. None of the local pet stores had flea combs that looked as good as the old one quality-wise. Overall, it seems durable and should last a while, hopefully as long as the previous one. We used the old comb for actual flea control, back when our cat still had fleas, but had long transitioned to using it for general combing and weeding out the loose hairs in our cat's fur, which he very much enjoys.
customer_reviews.author: Olga Batalov

customer_reviews.title: Great for chin acne
customer_reviews.text: A really quality comb, With comfortable round teeth that doesn’t scratch sensitive coats not At all flimsy or easily breakable On its own this is a fantastic flea comb, however it’s also great for combing out cat acne and eye crusty bits. That added bonus convinced me to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: MatthewGB

customer_reviews.title: Will Always Re-buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and this is actually the second one of these I bought. They are a good product. This one is a bit more stiff feeling in the bristles than the last, but than again that one I had for maybe a year and a half before the bristles started to bend. I'm sure this one just needs to be broken in, tho I do hope no bending happens. I bought one of these in the dog version and that one, two bristles already started to bend and come out, which when it happens, causes it to cut my poor pup. But the cat one hasn't shown any wear yet.
customer_reviews.author: Akira

customer_reviews.title: Best flea Combs, does an awesome job!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this flea Combs, because it's good quality, it's really thin do it does the job better on my cats fur. I have two cats and now they are smooth as silk,all the dander and flea debree has been easily removed and my cats tolerated it better then the other Combs.,! It's easy to hold also,and it's light. I am amazed how good it worked 😊
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia M Sobel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: This comb did a great job for the first two times using it. However two of the teeth bent and broke after the second use on my lab and it was not useable after that because teeth kept bending and falling out. Really unimpressed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this twice!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good flea comb especially for the price. One swipe through my cat's fur (medium haired) and it takes multiple fleas. I use this in addition to flea treatment from the vet. Sometimes the fleas with be caught on the outside of the comb and in that case you have to do dump it in the water really fast or they'll jump back onto my cat/on the floor. I use a plastic cup with water mixed with dish soap to kill the fleas. I love how instant this is. My cat doesn't enjoy this but does eventually get used to it. It's not like her regular brush.
customer_reviews.author: August

customer_reviews.title: Works great..
customer_reviews.text: Works great... on dry fleas. If the fleas are wet (cat in the bath), they get really slippery and slide right through the bristles. On a dry cat, this works much better, and I would assume that's really what this is intended for. Our daughters will sit and pick fleas off of our 2 cats, and this make it easier and faster. I've seen as many as 6 fleas come off in one pull! I'd suggest that the teeth could be just slightly closer, and this would be a 5 star item **If you found this review helpful, please mark it as helpful by clicking "Yes" below.**
customer_reviews.author: D&T Mackey

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: Since I got it, I have found 7 fleas on my each cat. I felt annoyed by how many fleas on them, but also satisfied that I found them. I read some bad review about it might break, and it sucks. Mine so far hasn't break, and if it happens, I will buy another one and maybe another durable one. Before that happens, I love flea comb. Comb 10 times a day, keep fleas away.
customer_reviews.author: taochuchun

customer_reviews.title: Works effectively
customer_reviews.text: This works well to pull fleas off my animals, as well as removing dirt, flea dirt and loose hair . And then I used a flea wipe to clean it, and it cleaned off easily that way-a Clorox wipe would work as well. The dog comb and the cat comb are exactly the same, and if you want to keep a separate comb for each, you'll have to mark them. I don't care about that, and could have done with one comb for all.
customer_reviews.author: Cathi

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick hair
customer_reviews.text: A few of the prongs already bent out of place and hurt my dog as I combed. Best for small hair or thin hair dogs. Find something else for thick hair dogs. It does capture fleas but the fleas easily and very quickly jump out.
customer_reviews.author: Kayte

customer_reviews.title: Great for shedding cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat sheds constantly, all year long, and just petting him I come away with fur. I bought this to try to get more of that fur off his coat, without annoying him like some other products do. I comb him every morning, and it picks up a lot of loose fur. It all comes out of the comb easily. He still sheds all day long, but at least I get some of it.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne In Bend

customer_reviews.title: Buy this comb for kittens !
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap this thing worked so well. I had a little plastic one and i thought I was doing ok. Oh I was not ! First stroke with this flea comb and there were soooooo many fleas. I got to work and got almost every one. So grateful for this comb for my tiny rescues that can’t have meds yet!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley

customer_reviews.title: Must buy if your dog has fleas
customer_reviews.text: Very good comb. It makes the job of getting fleas of rescues so much easier. Dogs with a short soft coat it’s must harder to get off but it will come off! It’s easy to work with just wish the handle was a little better. Amazing. Will buy again once this one breaks or is lost lol.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great flea comb
customer_reviews.text: We are currently in the middle of a flea population explosion because the fleas have built up a resistance to Frontline. This comb works really well to pick fleas out of cat hair. Sometimes it will get many fleas in one comb through. Then you can either dip it quickly in hot soapy water or squish them up against the hard plastic part of the comb.( Yes, it's gross but it works.) My cats really like it and will come right to me when they see me pick up the comb.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Safari Flea Comb for cats.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Use with a natural flea deterrent that won't harm your pet & it's very effective. For use while your pet is on revolution & the flea cycle is broken. The outside environment & the inside environment must be treated also. Be careful mixing chemical treatments (your pets internal system with environmental sprays) The teeth in the comb are closer together than most grooming tools & this removes the fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sadly this thing works way too well. I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this thing works way too well. I was thoroughly grossed out combing fleas out of my cat's thick white fur and watching them jump and crawl around on this comb. I immediately drowned them in soapy water and put them out of my cat's (and mine) absolute misery. I was sceeved out combing out eggs and watching as the comb killed the fleas that bust and left a red streak on his fur, I was beyond grossed out but plowed through this chore. Now I just have to find something that will keep the blood sucking beasts off my Beluga the Cat.
customer_reviews.author: 😩

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Comb !
customer_reviews.text: This comb alone got rid of my kitten's fleas. I've given him flea baths and nothing had been working but this comb really seemed to be able to grab them and pull them out. It's strong and a good material as well. Super great.
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Works just as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Suspected my cat had the beginnings of a flea invasion and this comb routed them out. We used it a few times a day until we could get his topical treatment. He enjoyed the combing. I imagine it scratched his itches! :) And it definitely collected the little buggers and their droppings. My cat has medium-length, soft "hair" (vs. coarse fur) and this did pull on it a little. If your cat has long hair, definitely use a regular brush to get out tangles before using this.
customer_reviews.author: S. LeeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great little thing! Cat feels like he is being groomed. Can be uncomfortable after a while but it works. It removes the fleas just like it should. One sweep and you are guaranteed to get fleas on that comb. Focus on areas where cats have most fleas like the face. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alexx

customer_reviews.title: My cat literally drools when I comb him. X)
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this thing. I had to hang it up out of reach and he literally tries to grab it with his paws and bite it when I'm holding it but not using it on him, as if to say "HURRY UP and brush me!" And when I do he purrs really hard and drools. Also the teeth are close enough to actually grab fleas. (Best way to deal with them once caught is a small piece of double sided tape. You use it to grab and seal up the flea like a spider does with webbing and flies, then you just through the tape piece away.)
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cat owners!
customer_reviews.text: This comb is amazing! It gets the fleas off the cats. It is so much easier now in between flea medicine to check the cats. Just put some water and blue dawn dish soap in a tall glass and dip the comb with the flea on it! The flea falls off and DIES in the water! Definately buy this comb for flea problems. You will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: It was a life saver
customer_reviews.text: It does need a little bit of work cuz you have to keep combing your cats hair for a few days , but eventually it will get all the lice and eggs out. I would recommend you to use this outside your house or the apartment causes lice tend to jump off the comb
customer_reviews.author: Black

customer_reviews.title: Sucks up fleas like a magnet
customer_reviews.text: Topical flea treatments were doing nothing here in SoCal for my two cats. This has been a record flea infestation season here, normally my cats have few to none. First full use I got 50 to 70 fleas off of each cat, it was disgusting and I had no idea there were so many fleas on my animals. Each subsequent day there are less and less. After about 5-6 days, I only get 2 or 3 fleas per combing. It seems to pick up many of the eggs\residue specks as well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my kitty when she got fleas and it did the trick. Nothing too fancy
customer_reviews.author: Kyla Turk

customer_reviews.title: Removes burs
customer_reviews.text: My Boxer/German Shepherd/Chow Chow mix has longer hair and he's constantly getting covered in burs on our walks in the woods. Comb does a decent a job on lifting the burs out of his fur. Comb is very thin and lightweight so i don't expect it to last long but at $4 that's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Flojos

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts but this really works. So far it is the only effective way of dealing with cat fleas I found. Comb cat in various areas and dip the comb in soap water each time. You can see fleas struggle in soap water for few seconds and then die. Cat feels better too.
customer_reviews.author: nramz

customer_reviews.title: Great flea comb
customer_reviews.text: This was the best comb for my kitten! The poor kitten was adopted and brought the fleas with her into my home at 10 weeks. I have never dealt with fleas this bad. The comb and hot water was great for catching and killing the fleas. Along with medication, I combed her hair with the flea comb twice a day to get rid of her fleas. I would purchase this flea comb again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Ava Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Safari Flea Comb
customer_reviews.text: Pins pulled out as I was cleaning my cat hair out of it! Pins weren't lined up evenly, upon arrival....
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Simple chemical free flea removal!
customer_reviews.text: This comb works perfectly for my cat. All I have to do is bribe him with some cat treats while I comb his fur. It picks up small and larger fleas easily. Then I quickly dunk the comb in a bowl of soapy water and fleas are dead! Cat is scratching less. We are glad we bought this comb!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Ucator

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job!
customer_reviews.text: We have two kittens (almost cats) and the flea problem has gotten basically out of control. We ordered this flea comb it arrived on time, and now we are literally spending our Friday night combing fleas out of the cats and it is immensely satisfying. Haha. This little comb hero, really does work! We may end up buying another one, so we have one for each cat!
customer_reviews.author: Harmony

customer_reviews.title: Great Comb, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great flea comb. When I purchased this I realized my cat had fleas. He doesn't like me to come at him with a comb or brush. What I did was let him smell this and then proceeded to comb him and he loved it. Now when I come to him with it he lays down to get his grooming. The comb did a great job of getting the fleas and the flea dirt off. I use this about once or twice a week. I would definitely recommend this to those looking to keep their pets flea free
customer_reviews.author: Diana Hanshaw

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This gets all the dry skin flakes off my older cat and her under coat. I originally bought it for my flea bag kitten. Who is now flea free by the way. It caught a good portion of fleas and was a good price. It's sturdy and I like the length of the handle so I can dip it in a cup of soapy water to drown those little blood suckers.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE FOR RESCUERS!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this comb. I keep misplacing then finding the original. I would not be without this comb. I rescue feral and homeless cats... need I say more? Absolutely perfect at getting fleas off the animal and keeping them between the rows of teeth, long enough for you to dip the comb in hot water, alcohol or whatever you are using to get thr bugs off of the comb. GREAT PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING IS AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: If you have a cat that has fleas and will NOT let you bathe them this will help. I comb the cat and the comb comes out with hair and fleas and you just dip the comb in a glass of warm/hot water (with dish soap such as Dawn or Joy with Lemon) and it kills the fleas, not to mention it gets out loose hair as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work like it’s supposed to!!
customer_reviews.text: This brush is absolute crap!! Doesn’t pick up the fleas at all!! Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my kitty 2 combs through the back and 6 fleas came right out very gentle kitty loved it he was purring honestly the best easy no chemical and inexpensive solution i came across. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Ale Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. I've always used a normal brush
customer_reviews.text: Safari Flea Comb for Cats, Green: Very good product. I've always used a normal brush, but I needed to find a comb that could remove fleas after my latest trip to the vet. This comb is very solid plastic, 6.25" inches long with a 2.25" wide metal comb; there are about 64 0.5" rounded teeth, each 0.5 mm thick and 0.1 mm apart. This has been very good not only for normal grooming, but especially for removing fleas from my cat. It seems ideal for shorthairs and possibly longhairs with thin coats.
customer_reviews.author: MPBH

customer_reviews.title: 2-pack single row cat comb is 1 2-row dog comb
customer_reviews.text: A bit surprised to receive one dog flea comb with two rows after ordering a 2-pack of the single row cat comb. Not that it matters, I guess, it's just a product labelling error (see photo of packaging with "cat" barcode but dog on the insert sleeve, and actual comb received). It works, does what we need, and is a good quality product regardless. It also cost slightly less than the 2-row dog comb which I guess is a bonus?
customer_reviews.author: miriam r

customer_reviews.title: No Fail! Great comb if you use it Right!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, good quality. ALL combs get fleas stuck in the teeth- but that’s better than them falling off. Just keep a natural flea spray on a paper towel when you comb . Comb with directionof fur then immediately slack into Center of half fold of paper towel and close your hand quickly! Fleas are trapped and your pet gets a mini natural treatment extra.🙂
customer_reviews.author: BlueLadyDay

customer_reviews.title: Really like it, especially the rounded teeth
customer_reviews.text: So it might be unusual to really like a flea comb, but I'm so happy I don't have to worry about hurting my small 18 year old cat since the teeth on this comb are rounded. Seems to work just like the one with the "sharper" edges, but doesn't hurt the cat if I accidentally don't comb her right. And it definitely (like the other models) removes the fleas with very little effort. Good job on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna H.

customer_reviews.title: Work Great on both Kittens and Pups
customer_reviews.text: I've taken many different furry friends that have often been neglected. This made cleaning them a whole lot easier. I've bought more then one. The plastic ones just aren't as durable or sanitary.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: As expected.
customer_reviews.text: Sami loves to be brushed. Wasn't sure he would like the comb...he does! Especially on his back by his tail and around his neck. If you think your cat has fleas, this is a great way to be sure.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret L E It

customer_reviews.title: Buy this comb if you’re cool
customer_reviews.text: This comb helped me find a fat a** flea on my cats neck. Very good product and it’s super cheap, so cheap that my friends ask me where I get the comb from. If this comb was a girl I’ll marry it in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Computer nerd

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: My kitten found the flea on when I gkt her from the foster. I tried to use the small comb, however, i is not work. Finally I brought this, it is easy to remove, and the kitten enjoys when pulling.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Better than the flea comb at PetSmart
customer_reviews.text: This is an effective tool for combing fleas off my cat. I dunk the comb in rubbing alcohol to kill any fleas caught in the comb. I bought the only flea comb at Pet Smart previously and the comb's teeth bent after a couple of uses. This comb from Amazon works well and is a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Stop for the One

customer_reviews.title: Great product!! My cats line up to be combed!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! I having been using Frontline and other topical flea treatments on my cats for years and this year it seems everything i try is not working. All of my indoor cats are still covered in fleas. This comb worked so well getting most of the fleas off and all five of my cats love it!! When i sit down to comb one of them the other four just show up waiting their turns!! It works great on long, medium and short hair. I have all three types. The cats fur is so soft and looks shiny and clean when i'm done. Even my 13 year old long hair cat loves being combed!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! The teeth are nice and fine. Got a ton of fleas and eggs off of my cat!
customer_reviews.author: DBH1027

customer_reviews.title: No Flea Too Small
customer_reviews.text: This comb will pick up the smallest flea. It combs easily through the thickest of our cats' fur but is still comfortable for our old skinny cat. I was afraid the teeth of the comb would be too sharp, but she isn't complaining so far. Now, if it doesn't rust, it'll be the perfect cat comb.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisie T

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SAVER
customer_reviews.text: This is a DREAM when it comes to fleas on my cat! This flea comb gets rid of these critters with such ease. It really has helped me! The only down side is that the fleas get stuck between the comb, which is great because they can’t get away but need to wipe it down after each time you brush through fur.
customer_reviews.author: Eyesha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any fleas for more years than I can count, and then BOOM! They got us. My poor kitty was miserable as we wait for the topical I put on her to break the flea life cycle. After combing her and washing the fleas/dander off in a bowl of water with dish soap, as other reviewers had said, she is like a different cat. She is not miserable! She seems happy and can finally sleep. And I take great satisfaction with every flea I catch and drown, one down, whoever the heck knows how many to go, but it made an instant difference. Best $5 I ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Buti

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price, arrived on time.
customer_reviews.text: I foster kittens and often they have many issues, one is cat fleas which are so tiny you can't see them especially on a kitten with dark fur. This tool works to help remove adult fleas dead or alive.
customer_reviews.author: Danny C Oberst

customer_reviews.title: Not as fine as it claims
customer_reviews.text: too coarse for small fleas. I used to use plastic ones, and definitely the plastic ones are finer and can catch fleas much better.
customer_reviews.author: ay

customer_reviews.title: The BEST little flea comb ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: BEST little flea comb ever and I have 11 cats to practice on!!! LOL.. I use a sticky roller brush normally used for getting lint off of clothes but instead I use it for defleaing my cats. I use the flea comb and then whenever I find a flea I stick it on the sticky brush then kill it using the end of the comb. It works better than anything I've tried!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lummus

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it and works well
customer_reviews.text: Cat loves this comb and it works well to clean off debris and fleas. When my cat had fleas, I combed and combed to find/get them off. Now I use it to check for fleas/signs of fleas just be combing her back. Be sure to have a water bowl with dawn soap ready in case you comb one out.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie S

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAT FLEA COMB
customer_reviews.text: THIS SURELY BEATS USING CHEMICALS ON YOUR CAT. I HAVE FOUND NO FLEAS ON HIM, NOR DID I EXPECT ANY, BUT HE SEEMS TO FIND THE COMB SOOTHING. THEY DO WORK, THOUGH, BECAUSE I HAVE TRIED THESE COMBS ON OUTDOOR CATS, AND THEY DO TRAP FLEAS.
customer_reviews.author: G. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Great for my cats
customer_reviews.text: I use it with warm water with a little bit of blue Dawny dishwasher. Most of the fleas and eggs and etc are removed in few passes. Must to keep the cup with the water very close to you to avoid fleas jump out the comb. My cats don’t like it, very they tolerate it.
customer_reviews.author: Always naturalwhenpossible

product_meta.title: Safari Pet Products Flea Comb for Cats, Flea and Tick Prevention for Cats, Cat Flea Treatment, Flea Prevention
product_meta.description: Pet Products SAFARI Flea Comb for Cats, Flea and Tick Prevention for Cats, Cat Flea Treatment, Flea Prevention
feature_bullets: Long or short hair breed compatible

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
